definition: two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

sentences.english: What do you think about the two-party system in the United States?
sentences.chinese: 你認爲美國的兩黨制怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Thus in this period, the subject concerning two-party system and party competes becomes hot point.
sentences.chinese: 因而這一時期有關兩黨制和黨爭的話題成爲言論熱點。

sentences.english: Putting the Democratic legislative barons in the driver's seat has undercut bipartisanship.
sentences.chinese: 把民主黨立法者放在司機的位置上會削弱兩黨制。

sentences.english: There is a further impetus toward the two-party solution, and that is the Electoral College system for choosing presidents.
sentences.chinese: 由選舉團選舉總統的制度進一步強化了兩黨制。

sentences.english: The American political system is a classical example of the two-party system.
sentences.chinese: 美國的政治體制是兩黨制的典型範例。

sentences.english: The narrow two-party system we have right now has not served us very well.
sentences.chinese: 我們現行的狹隘的兩黨制並沒有很好地爲我們服務。

sentences.english: The organize the electorate very simply by maintaining the two-party system.
sentences.chinese: 他們通過維持兩黨制，很輕鬆地組織選民。
